text:
.@SteveScalise and I were elected to Congress together through special elections and became close friends. A principled conservative and fierce fighter, Steve can unite our Conference and deliver for the American people.

I am proud to support him for Speaker of the House.

Thrilled to see @Flack4RIC receive $1 million in federal grant awards to increase flight service to the West Coast for Virginians.

Proud to have helped advocate for this critical funding alongside my Virginia Delegation colleagues!

Enjoyed participating in @scsp_ai’s Global Emerging Tech Summit to offer a congressional perspective on the lessons learned in Ukraine. 

The CCP is the pacing threat to the U.S., and we must remain focused on developing our military’s technologies to deter our adversaries.

No Member of Congress should receive a paycheck for failing to get their job done on time while hardworking Americans suffer the consequences. For this reason, I have requested that my salary be withheld in the event of a government shutdown.

Pleased to be joining @CSIS this morning for a discussion on Congress’ approach to countering Chinese political warfare.

Tune in now ⬇️

Proud to join @RepJenKiggans in this important effort to ensure our servicemembers continue to receive the pay they deserve in the event of a government shutdown.

We will not let the lack of regular order in Washington place a financial burden on our troops and their families.

The escalating Chinese aggression in the South China Sea highlights the importance of supporting our Indo-Pacific partners and strengthening U.S. military presence in the region.

Freedom of navigation in this trade route is essential for global stability. nytimes.com/2023/09/23/world…
Wishing a peaceful and meaningful Yom Kippur to all those observing this holy day.

Inaction Has Consequences Act:

Withholds Members’ pay if all 12 appropriations bills are not done by the end of the fiscal year.

No Budget, No Pay Act:

Withholds Members’ pay if a budget isn’t passed by April 15.

Stay on Schedule (S.O.S) Resolution: 

Keeps Members in Washington instead of breaking for August recess if all appropriations bills are not passed by the end of July.

On this, I agree. Members of Congress should not be rewarded for shutting down the government. 
 
For years, I’ve authored legislation that holds Members accountable for failing to do their job:
- Stay on Schedule (S.O.S)
- No Budget, No Pay
- Inaction Has Consequences

Proud to see my bill, the SHARKED Act, pass out of the Natural Resources Committee – we are committed to ensuring our fishermen can carry out their jobs on the water while keeping sharks safe.

Thank you @RepGarretGraves for your collaboration and support on this important issue.

Proud to see my alma mater @VCU recognized as one of the most innovative public universities in the nation. The faculty, researchers, and staff at VCU do incredible work in providing students with new, accessible, and proven paths to success.

Go Rams!

news.vcu.edu/article/2023/09…

Pleased to see the establishment of the Virginia-Taiwan Trade Office, which will serve to strengthen bilateral business priorities and trade relationships between the Commonwealth and Taiwan.

Thank you @GovernorVA for your leadership.

governor.virginia.gov/newsro…

China and Russia's exploitation of semiconductor export loopholes emphasizes the need for stronger regulations that crack down on open-source development tech.

The security threat of our adversaries' use of these technologies must be taken seriously.
thehill.com/opinion/technolo…

Wishing a happy birthday to the @usairforce!

For 76 years now, the remarkable men and women of our Air Force have kept our skies safe and our nation secure.

Thank you for your service and commitment to our great nation — we salute you!

Today we reflect on the wisdom of our Founding Fathers who signed the Constitution 236 years ago. This living document continues to guide our nation, ensuring that freedom and democracy prevail. On this #ConstitutionDay, join me in honoring our Constitution’s enduring legacy.

Wishing a happy and blessed Rosh Hashanah to those celebrating around the world!
 
May the new year bring you happiness and peace.

On POW/MIA Recognition Day, I'm grateful for the incredible strength of our servicemembers who endured captivity and thinking of our heroes who are still missed. Their sacrifices embody our nation's resilience — let us honor their memory and ensure their legacy lives on.

At today’s @waysandmeansgop hearing, I advocated for my bill: the Freedom to Invest in Tomorrow’s Workforce Act.

We must improve access to workforce training by expanding 529 savings accounts so hardworking Americans can secure in-demand, well-paying jobs.

Watch ⬇️

22 years ago today, enemies attacked our nation and took the lives of nearly 3,000 people. Yet, in the face of darkness, Americans joined together and found strength.

Today, let us remember those we lost and pray for those whose lives changed forever.

We will never forget.

As China grows more hostile in the Indo-Pacific, a strong U.S.-Taiwan relationship is of the utmost importance in our nation's efforts to deter the malicious behavior of the Chinese Communist Party.

Read more about my meeting with President Tsai ⬇️
taipeitimes.com/News/front/a…

As China expands its military footprint across the globe, it's imperative for the DoD to recalibrate its engagement efforts with Beijing’s target nations to better promote the United States as the primary strategic and economic partner of choice.

cnn.com/2023/09/01/asia/chin…

Today, we celebrate the hard work, talent, and achievements of the American workforce who keep our nation running. 

Happy Labor Day!

On this day in 1945, Japan formally surrendered to the Allies, officially ending World War II. 
 
On the 78th anniversary of Victory Over Japan Day, join me in remembering the sacrifices of those who served to secure freedom around the world.

China's unprovoked aggression toward Taiwan is a threat to the rest of the free world.

We must continue strengthening our relationships in the Indo-Pacific to deter the malign intentions of the Chinese Communist Party.

apnews.com/article/taiwan-us…

Fukushima’s water release is backed by science — Japan should be commended for its transparency. 

China’s attempts to spread disinformation among its neighbors is disappointing but expected.
apnews.com/article/japan-fuk…

Allowing the Chinese Communist Party to influence U.S. export controls is incredibly dangerous.

Make no mistake: this is a one-way deal in China's favor.

When will President Biden actually stand up to China and protect American interests?
apnews.com/article/china-us-…

I am praying for strength and a speedy recovery for my friend @SteveScalise as he begins treatment – I have no doubt he will tackle this with the same energy and tenacity he brings to the House floor.

As the Davidson window approaches, the U.S. military must accelerate and deploy autonomous platforms, as I’ve championed in my Autonomous Systems Adoption and Policy Act. I’m pleased to see DoD finally start embracing autonomy as we work to outpace the CCP.breakingdefense.com/2023/08/…
May God bless our troops and their families.

To this day, not one member of the Biden administration has been held accountable for their botched withdrawal from Afghanistan. 

It’s time for all of those who have served our nation over the past two decades, and their loved ones, to get the answers they deserve.

Two years ago today, we witnessed the deadliest attack on U.S. forces in over a decade when a suicide bomber entered the Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul, Afghanistan, taking the lives of 13 selfless United States servicemembers.

By meeting with Chinese Communist Party officials without setting any preconditions, the Biden administration is failing to project American strength.

Watch my interview with @cherylcasone on @MorningsMaria about Secretary Raimondo's trip to China.👇

It's clear that under President Biden's economy, Americans are spending more while getting less.

We must rein in the runaway inflation that's hurting families by implementing sound economic policies that will put more money back into hardworking Americans' pockets.

Sharks are taking anglers' catch across U.S. waters – even as north as Connecticut.
 
I introduced the SHARKED Act to establish a real effort to address shark depredation, which will protect marine life and keep our fishermen and women safe.
 
foxnews.com/lifestyle/half-e…

Happy #NationalAviationDay!

Thank you to the pioneers and professionals who have advanced our nation’s aviation industry and ensure it continues to thrive.

As our adversaries continue to grow their nuclear arsenal, the U.S. must modernize our military's nuclear capabilities in the air, on land, and at sea.

I joined the ANWA Deterrence Center Forum to discuss this and more. Hear my thoughts below:

piped.video/--47WBC5Lrg

Last week, I participated in the Australian American Leadership Dialogue to discuss how to strengthen U.S. supply chains for critical minerals and rare earth elements.
 
We cannot allow the Chinese Communist Party to control the world’s critical minerals supply.

We cannot stand idly by while other nations accelerate their mine programs. We must leverage emerging technologies to revitalize U.S. mine countermeasures and capabilities, which is why I fought for a renewed focus on naval mine warfare in the #FY24NDAA.

warontherocks.com/2023/08/le…
DAV Thrift Stores support @DavVirginia’s incredible work in serving disabled veterans in the community. Thank you to the kind staff who welcomed me to their Williamsburg location.

Two years ago today, we watched Kabul fall to the Taliban.
 
Congress remains committed to investigating President Biden’s disastrous withdrawal from Afghanistan and holding the administration accountable for the failures that led to that horrific day.

The time has come to unleash the true potential of nuclear energy to address our nation’s energy production, economic growth, and national security challenges.

Read my op-ed on why I introduced the 21st Century American Atomic Energy Age Act:
washingtonexaminer.com/resto…

Today I joined @cherylcasone on @FoxBusiness to discuss the alarming increase in cooperation between China and Russia as well as transparency and accountability in funding for Ukraine.

Watch the full interview ⬇️

I am proud to cosponsor the DITCH Act to ensure we are prioritizing U.S. interests over profiting off the Chinese market.

American universities should not receive preferential treatment if they choose to finance a genocidal communist regime.
forbes.com/sites/kenrapoza/2…

As gas prices skyrocket, Congress must take action to relieve the pain at the pump that so many Americans are feeling right now. 

That's why I supported the Lower Energy Costs Act to restore domestic energy production and secure American energy independence.

During @VAGovernor Youngkin’s event at Crestview Elementary School in Richmond, I spoke on how we can empower parents and best support our children’s education across the Commonwealth. 

I remain committed to expanding education opportunities at the federal level.

More nations are waking up to the Chinese Communist Party’s malicious agenda. 

I’m pleased to see Italy consider leaving the Belt and Road Initiative, which is the CCP’s attempt to wield global influence and create dependence on Chinese investments.
nbcnews.com/news/world/italy…

As we approach the Davidson window, we must strengthen U.S.-Japan military coordination. The #FY24NDAA includes steps to align operations and integrated planning with Tokyo – I’m pleased to see bipartisan efforts to enhance this critical alliance.
asia.nikkei.com/Politics/Int…

It is encouraging to see progress in domestic and partner mining and processing capacity for rare earth elements and lithium. We must do everything we can to secure our supply chain and reduce dependence on China, an effort I championed in the #FY24NDAA.
hoover.org/research/progress…

On this National Purple Heart Day, we honor and remember our courageous men and women in uniform who were wounded or killed while serving our country. We owe them a tremendous debt of gratitude for their service and sacrifice.
Happy Birthday to the @USCG! For 233 years now, the U.S. Coast Guard has protected our nation’s waterways with honor, respect, and devotion. #SemperParatus

The CCP's insidious attempts to embed malware on U.S. military installations are deeply concerning — we need more details on the extent and impact of these cyber campaigns.

I joined my colleagues in asking the Biden administration for more information: alfordforms.house.gov/upload…

In the #FY24NDAA, I championed the elevation of the DoD's Defense Innovation Unit and the advancement of autonomous systems for the U.S. military.

This @HudsonInstitute report details the importance of embracing new military technologies:
hudson.org/fighting-bastions…

What a fun day at the @metrorhmdzoo — I met with local officials and employees to learn more about the zoo’s history and role in the community.
 
I also spent time with a few animals recuperating from a recent fire. Happy to report they are on their way to a full recovery!

As the CCP attempts to evade sanctions for their human rights abuses, they have no reservations using American lives as a bargaining chip. I joined my colleagues to urge the Biden administration to hold the CCP accountable for fueling the fentanyl crisis: youngkim.house.gov/sites/evo…

China is the world's most egregious illegal fishing offender. We must work closely with our allies in the region to deter this behavior, which is why I championed a #FY24NDAA provision to counter illegal, unreported, and unregulated fishing.
realcleardefense.com/article…

Today I joined @TeamCavuto on @FoxBusiness to discuss @committeeonccp's investigation into investment firms funneling Americans' savings into CCP-controlled companies. We can't allow U.S. dollars to fund the CCP's military modernization or human rights violations.
I'll be joining @TeamCavuto on @FoxBusiness shortly — be sure to tune in!

Each year, the Boys & Girls Club of the Northern Neck provides hundreds of kids in Lancaster, Northumberland, and Richmond County with a variety of academic, leadership, and recreation programs. It was such a treat to tour their headquarters in Kilmarnock today.

As co-chair of the House Rural Broadband Caucus, ensuring rural communities receive high-speed internet access is one of my top priorities. Thank you to @AllPointsBB for the update on their recent projects in underserved markets on Virginia’s Northern Neck.

Today I met with @VCUHealth officials and toured their hospital in Tappahannock. These healthcare providers play an integral role on the Middle Peninsula and Northern Neck — it was great to hear about their plans to secure services for veterans and the broader community.
I continue my focus on countering China’s economic, political, and strategic aggression through my role on the bipartisan Indo-Pacific Task Force and the House Select @committeeonccp.

Thank you to my colleagues @RepStefanik, @RepDonaldsPress, @RepMMM, @RepBuddyCarter, @RepMcCormick, @RepCarolMiller, @RepSteel, & @RepBradWenstrup for joining me in urging the Biden administration to keep all options open to ensure mineral security and take this threat seriously.

Resilient supply chains are vital to U.S. national security, yet we are allowing China to grow its hold on the global supply chain. We can’t keep relying on foreign adversaries to meet our critical mineral demands.

Read my letter to @POTUS and @SecDef: wittman.house.gov/uploadedfi…

Pleased to see the Tanker Security Program move forward, which is an initiative I worked on with my colleague @RepJoeCourtney to bolster U.S. military readiness in the Indo-Pacific.
breakingdefense.com/2023/07/…

AUKUS is vital to stability and security in the Indo-Pacific — I am committed to its success.

To guarantee our shared strength, the president must take action to strengthen the U.S. submarine industrial base.

Read the letter my colleagues and I sent to the White House:

Today marks the 70th anniversary of the end of the Korean War.

On this National Korean War Veterans Armistice Day, we honor the brave men and women who fought for freedom and peace. Their service and sacrifice will never be forgotten.

At tonight's @committeeonccp hearing, witnesses made one thing clear: we must do everything we can to protect America’s position as a global technological leader. We cannot allow the Chinese Communist Party to continue to steal trade secrets and commit industrial espionage.

Anglers across U.S. waters are losing their catch to sharks, which is why I introduced a bill to identify solutions to shark depredation and to protect our marine ecosystems.

In the spirit of #SharkWeek, read more about the SHARKED Act:

In just three days, Congress breaks for August recess – but much of our work remains unfinished.

Read my piece in @RTDNEWS on holding Members accountable if they fail to get the job done on time:
richmond.com/zzstyling/view-…

Despite recent criteria changes to site evaluations for the new FBI Headquarters, Springfield remains the ideal location. I joined my Virginia delegation colleagues in urging the GSA and FBI to ensure a fair analysis and expedite the evaluation process.

Support continues to grow for the Freedom to Invest in Tomorrow's Workforce Act! 

@RepSpanberger and I are leading this effort to allow folks to use their 529 accounts to cover credential and training program expenses — this is critical to Virginia's workforce development.

The Biden administration doesn’t seem to understand what the facts clearly show: we must invest in our national defense at a level that would effectively deter aggression from the Chinese Communist Party.
With a historically high number of incursions in Taiwan, it is evident that the Biden administration has failed to deter the CCP’s aggression across the Indo-Pacific and beyond.
During this week’s @committeeonccp hearing, Defense Department officials simply could not defend the Biden administration’s weak policies that have emboldened the Chinese Communist Party.

We can't be afraid of exploring autonomy in our military if we want to compete with our adversaries.

My Autonomous Systems and Policy Act — parts of which were included in the #FY24NDAA — will accelerate its development and adoption within the DoD.

insidedefense.com/insider/wi…

The health of the Chesapeake Bay is vital to the economic and environmental stability of Virginia's First District.

Proud to join my colleagues in reintroducing the important Chesapeake Bay SEEE Act to restore and safeguard the bay's watershed.
wittman.house.gov/news/docum…

The @committeeonccp held a productive debate with policy experts on trade and economic engagement with China, during which I highlighted China’s alarming lead in critical and emerging technologies across defense, space, energy, and biotech. America needs to wake up and catch up.

I was pleased to join @NDIAToday at their #NDIAJADC2 Symposium to stress the urgent need for streamlined data sharing through Combined Joint All-Domain Command and Control across the joint force to enhance our military’s effectiveness.

The Chinese Communist Party’s military is outpacing the U.S. military at an alarming rate.

Pleased to see our Navy has set a competitive battle force goal – I'm committed to equipping our warfighters to meet this era of great power competition.

news.usni.org/2023/07/18/nav…

President Biden has suspended U.S. funding to China’s Wuhan Lab – but more must be done.

I introduced the World Deserves to Know Act to sanction CCP officials involved in the origins of COVID-19 and provide Americans with the truth about the pandemic. washingtonexaminer.com/news/…

The shipbuilding capacity gap between China and the United States is alarming – we must ensure our Navy can challenge Chinese fleets in future high-end conflicts. 

This is exactly why I fought for key shipbuilding provisions in the #FY24NDAA.

thedrive.com/the-war-zone/al…

America is better off because of our special relationship with Israel – I will always stand up to defend our friend and ally. I look forward to hearing President Herzog address Congress tomorrow as we commemorate the 75th anniversary of Israel’s statehood.
apnews.com/article/israel-he…

If the United States is to fulfill our end of the AUKUS agreement, President Biden must increase U.S. submarine production. Thank you @SenatorWicker for highlighting this urgent issue, which I continue to advocate for through my role on @HASCRepublicans.
wsj.com/articles/the-u-s-nav…

Legislation to renew the Generalized System of Preferences program is long overdue and vital to reducing our reliance on China. I joined my colleagues on both sides of the aisle in asking the Ways and Means Committee to take action on this critical issue: dunn.house.gov/_cache/files/…

After many hours of thoughtful debate, I am pleased to see Congress pass this critical piece of legislation to ensure the U.S. military is the most effective and lethal fighting force in the world. 

My full statement on the House passage of the #FY24NDAA:

Today I delivered remarks on the House floor in support of the #FY24NDAA. To meet this era of great power competition with the Chinese Communist Party, this year’s bill equips our brave men and women in uniform with the resources they need to fulfill their mission.

The #FY24NDAA invests in new technologies to spur defense innovation, including through the following efforts I fought for:

➡️ Codifying the elevation of the Defense Innovation Unit 
➡️ Including the DOD Entrepreneurial Innovation Act

The #FY24NDAA equips our warfighters with the tools they need to be ready to fight. It includes many provisions I championed, including:

➡️ Improving domestic manufacturing of energetic materials for munitions
➡️ Rejecting the Biden administration’s effort to shrink the Navy

Taking care of our servicemembers and their families is a top priority for me. The #FY24NDAA includes the following bills that I co-led:

➡️ The COMFORT Act: Authorizing more mental health services for military families
➡️ H.R.3011: Creating a DOD mental health task force

We’re also increasing oversight and demanding accountability from the Biden administration through the Independent and Objective Oversight of Ukrainian Assistance Act, which I reintroduced this year.

Read more: wittman.house.gov/news/docum…

The #FY24NDAA implements smart budget savings and reforms by:

➡️ Saving taxpayers $40 billion without sacrificing national security
➡️ Cutting over $5.8 billion in weapons programs that haven’t met development milestones

In the #FY24NDAA, I am pursuing the following amendments to counter China’s increasing aggression:

➡️ Expediting munitions deliveries to fill weapons backlogs to allies by establishing reserves of long-lead items
➡️ Mandating assessments of potential future conflict

After many hours of drafting and marking up this bill, the #FY24NDAA is finally on the House floor. This critical piece of legislation will set the framework for America’s defense policy and ensure the U.S. military remains the most effective fighting force in the world.

I've been adamant in my efforts to reduce U.S. reliance on China — we cannot hand them even more control of the global coal market.

At today's @NatResources hearing, I asked witnesses where the U.S. stands if we keep failing to promote domestic coal production.

Watch 👇

Yesterday, I met with executives from Hanover County Airport and local officials to tour their facility. We had a thoughtful discussion on new development ideas for regional airports — thank you for having me.

It was great to meet with our Marines stationed at @MCIWPendletonCA and to see the new technology they’re using to advance our national defense capabilities. I will continue to ensure our troops have the resources they need to carry out their mission.

Virginians shouldn't be penalized for withdrawing their 529 funds to afford workforce trainings and certifications.

That's why I'm working to expand 529 accounts to cover these costs and help Virginians secure in-demand, well-paying jobs.

Read more:
richmond.com/news/state-regi…

Pleased to see the bipartisan work of the @committeeonccp highlighted here. Countering the Chinese Communist Party’s hostile agenda is not a partisan issue – Democrats and Republicans must stand united in addressing this growing national security threat.
washingtonexaminer.com/polic…

U.S. national security relies on private sector innovation to remain at the cutting edge of military technology. Pleased to see many of the nation’s top-tier defense and national security startups recognized on @SVDG_official’s #NatSec100 list.

Read more: siliconvalleydefense.org/nat…

Happy 90th anniversary to @ASAFishing!

ASA does incredible work for the sportfishing industry across the nation, and it was an honor to enter an extension of remarks into the congressional record to recognize their 90 years of advocacy and leadership.

asafishing.org/advocacy/poli…

Through my @HASCRepublicans and @committeeonccp roles, I'm working to protect our defense supply chains from excessive reliance on China. That's why I proposed a #FY24NDAA amendment to safeguard U.S. access to critical minerals and Rare Earth Elements.
bloomberg.com/news/articles/…

Next week, I’ll be holding a telephone town hall to answer your questions and provide updates on my work in Washington on behalf of Virginia’s First District.

Register here to participate: wittman.house.gov/forms/form…

Happy Independence Day! Since 1776, America has stood for freedom, opportunity, and liberty — I’m grateful for all the men and women who have defended these principles throughout our great nation's history.
 
Wishing you all a safe and happy Fourth!

Biden's student loan forgiveness plan was an insult to the hardworking Americans who already paid back their student loans and those who didn't have the opportunity to attend college.

I'm pleased to see SCOTUS rule against this unconstitutional bailout.
foxbusiness.com/politics/sup…

This week, the @USGAO published a report detailing the poor conditions of the U.S. Navy's shipyards. Investing in our military infrastructure is a matter of national security — I continue to advocate for this at the federal level.

Read the report: gao.gov/products/gao-23-1060…

The CCP's only intention is to destroy the United States. American business investments in China are incredibly reckless and put our nation’s economic security on a dangerous path.

We are feeding the wolf that will eat us—these investments must stop. 

Watch ⬇️

I’m concerned about this potential merger between two of America’s critical valve production companies. At a time when we are expanding the submarine industrial base to meet future requirements, we need more information before deciding to support a valve consolidation proposal.

I introduced the SHARKED Act to protect anglers, sharks, and marine ecosystems. Shark depredation is increasing in our nation’s waters, and my bill would help identify research and funding opportunities to address this growing issue. washingtonexaminer.com/news/…

Under no circumstances should we renew the U.S.-China Agreement on Cooperation in Science and Technology, which has been previously exploited by the PRC for military purposes. I joined my @committeeonccp colleagues to call on the @StateDept to safeguard our national security.

In this year’s NDAA, I fought to secure a 5.2% pay raise for service members, which will ripple through Virginia’s economy. I’m pleased that the #FY24NDAA includes major wins for the Commonwealth, given our high active duty military population.
richmond.com/news/state-regi…

The Biden admin claims they're increasing access to refuge lands while phasing out the use of affordable lead ammo and tackle for hunters and anglers.

My Protecting Access for Hunters & Anglers Act actually defends refuge access for sportsmen and women. wittman.house.gov/news/docum…

The #FY24NDAA will support U.S. servicemembers and their families, ensure military and industrial base readiness, and deploy innovative technologies while implementing efficient budget savings and accountability measures.

My full statement on its passage out of committee:

The cost of used Roll-on/Roll-off ships has gone up and frankly, they can’t do everything and are currently not available. We need to fully use excess industrial base capacity and recapitalize our logistics fleet.

Proud to have my bill, the Protecting Access for Hunters and Anglers Act, advance out of @NatResources.

Sportsmen and women play a critical role in conserving our lands and wildlife. Science doesn't support blanket bans on hunting ammunition and fishing tackle.

Great to see passage of my amendment funding the Space Constellation Security Program – this will increase the security of our assets in space by creating a resilient space architecture. Thank you @RepDLamborn for your support.

Pleased to see my amendment pass ordering SecDef to provide a plan to resource and retain any ships prevented from divestment by the #FY24NDAA. We've got to maximize our fleet to ensure military readiness.
We adopted my amendment to fund the @MarineCorpsFdn and @USMCMuseum — thank you to @RepTrentKelly, @RepJackBergman, and @RepMcCormick for your support.
My amendment to improve U.S. energetics enterprise also passed. This will strengthen our ability to manufacture missiles and other weapons systems to prepare for a near peer conflict.

I’m pleased to see the elevation of DIU codified this year.

Read more on why I’ve continued to advocate for this critical effort: defensenews.com/industry/202…

We also adopted two more of my amendments to:

➡️Recommend further collaboration between the IC and DIU
➡️Order a GAO review to determine how new authorities provided by Congress have been utilized by the DoD

HASC also passed the following amendments of mine, which will require the DoD to:

➡️ Update warfighting requirements for confronting Russia
➡️ Identify reciprocal steps to respond to Russia's decision to leave the Conventional Forces in Europe Treaty

The committee also adopted my amendments that:

➡️ Direct the DoD to provide recommendations for 5 capability-based program portfolios
➡️ Order a GAO report to improve the DoD's requirements process

This morning, HASC passed some of my top-priority amendments:

➡️ Ordering DoD to explore options to increase our ability to source/process critical minerals to decrease reliance on foreign adversaries
➡️ Requiring the DoD to accelerate fielding of capabilities to counter China

Each year, the House Armed Services Committee crafts the NDAA by drafting legislation, amendments, and conference requests. This year’s #FY24NDAA will combat CCP aggression, increase defense innovation, and equip our warfighters to defend our nation.

Follow along for updates ⬇️

This morning, I delivered my opening remarks for the HASC markup on the #FY24NDAA.

The strategic competition stage we find ourselves on with the CCP is sobering, and delivering a defense budget that elevates our capabilities above that of our adversaries is non-negotiable.

Today begins the full markup of the #FY24NDAA, including a broad range of provisions that will boost America’s military capability and readiness.

Tune in: piped.video/live/u_M6Fd4rcpU…

I’m deeply concerned about the state of our naval fleet – we can't retire ships early and expect to reach our goal of a 355-ship fleet. That’s why @HASCRepublicans will use this year’s NDAA to take a greater oversight role in Navy ship maintenance.
defensenews.com/congress/bud…

It's time to take concrete steps to counter China's growing influence. From bolstering our military capabilities to investing in emerging technologies, the #FY24NDAA shows our commitment to protecting American interests.

Read more:
dailycallernewsfoundation.or…

With rising threats and inventory gaps, it's crucial for the #FY24NDAA to prioritize innovation and agility in our defense systems. We need to accelerate drone testing and fielding to ensure our forces stay ahead of the curve.
c4isrnet.com/naval/2023/06/1…

Additionally, I introduced the 21st Century American Atomic Energy Age Act to move toward more innovative and widescale adoption—including small modular reactors—and to accelerate America’s deployment of nuclear energy.

Read the bill: congress.gov/bill/118th-cong…

I was proud to help secure House passage of the Lower Energy Costs Act to increase U.S. production of energy and critical minerals, reform energy permitting, and roll back the natural gas tax.

Read more: wittman.house.gov/news/docum…

Thank you @VAGovernor for highlighting the importance of American energy independence. Through my role on the House @NatResources Committee, I’ve continued to fight for an all-of-the-above energy strategy that puts America first and promotes responsible energy development.

I'm livid with the Pentagon's proposal to decommission more amphibious warships. These ships are the backbone of Navy-Marine Corps operations, from combat to humanitarian missions. It's foolish to walk away from this capability.
13newsnow.com/article/news/n…

I thank my partners in the Senate for addressing this shortfall of the Biden administration to prioritize military readiness.
 
Read their letter to the Pentagon: sullivan.senate.gov/imo/medi……

Having at least 31 amphibious ships is vital to the Marine Corps’ mission. Although my bill—which set a floor for amphibs—became law through the FY23 NDAA, the DOD is still failing to meet this requirement.
 
 news.usni.org/2023/06/13/cmc…

First, Bill Gates meets with Xi Jinping on promoting U.S.-China relations. Then, Secretary Blinken sits down with Xi without setting any pre-conditions.
 
These meetings don't correlate with the current geopolitical reality: the CCP is adversarial to the U.S.

Watch👇

Finally, squeezing one more year out of the Nimitz (CVN 68) and retiring it in FY26 immediately before the Ike (CVN 69) FY27 will impact O&M dollars in FY24 and FY25. It implies that while the CNO is prioritizing readiness, those accounts will be more strained as well.

Taking out 3 LSDs with a combined total of 13 years of service life remaining while the USMC’s top UPL priority remains LPD 33, directly leads to a contracting amphib force structure over the next 30 years. insidedefense.com/sites/insi…

On to decoms. Accelerating the retirement of CGs like Vicksburg remains baffling when our undersea vertical launch system capacity, surface VLS capacity, and torpedo capacity are all set to decline between now and 2030.

SSNs: Within the Davidson window, each of the 3 alternatives results in our attack submarine fleet contracting to 48 subs by FY26 and only Alternative 2 reaches the requirement of 66 attack subs by FY49.

Frigates: By failing to max out the FFG-62 production line, the Navy will prevent the potential award of a second frigate yard which both undermines the fleet as it shifts to more distributed operations with smaller platforms and constrains the industrial base long-term.

Destroyers: While Alternative 3 was built without funding constraints, it was based on "what the Department assess the industrial base could support," which does not include 3 destroyers until FY36 at the earliest, but Congress bought 3 DDGs last year.

Amphibs: The FY23 NDAA set a floor of 31 traditional L-class amphibs for the USMC. Disregarding the law, none of the 3 alternatives would reach this minimum between now and FY53. This is strange since Alternative 3 was built "without funding constraints."cq.com

Setting aside the Navy's poor efforts to communicate with Congress, the FY24 plan demonstrates an astonishing number of judgement errors that will have real consequences for our naval forces, even as Beijing expands the PLAN rapidly in the Indo-Pacific.

The Navy knows Congress was frustrated with the service presenting three shipbuilding plan alternatives last year. We always expect variation in a 30-year plan, but last year we saw worst-case scenarios presented as viable alternatives.
